content: What is the name of the world's largest ocean, covering more than 60 million square miles and separating Asia from the Americas?

The name of the world's largest ocean is the Pacific Ocean. It covers over 60 million square miles and separates Asia from the Americas. The Pacific Ocean is not only the largest but also the deepest ocean on Earth, with an average depth of about 13,000 feet. It plays a crucial role in global climate patterns and is home to a diverse array of marine life.
